name: wind turbine network connection construction, 4.5MW, onshore | wind turbine network connection, 4.5MW, onshore | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5736/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of the network connection for a wind turbine with 4.5MW capacity. This connection connects one turbine to the electricity network.;The main components of a network connection of a wind turbine are the cables, the transformer and the sub-station with the circuit breaker and the electricity meter inside it. According to (European Communities 2001), electricity produced with wind turbines is connected to medium voltage or high voltage systems, depending on the size of the windfarm.;;(Chataignere & Le Boulch 2003) do not provide any specification of the network connection (type and length of cables, voltage). Data are directly used as first approximation. ;;Sources:;European Communities. 2001. Wind Turbine Grid Connection and Interaction. Deutsches Windenergie-Institut /Tech-wise A/S /DM Energy, p. 7 Tab.2.1

From the transformation of pasture land to industrial site, and from the reception and treatment of building materials at construction site.

This activity ends with the decommissioning of the network connection and the treatment of the resulting materials at the end of the lifetime.

This dataset includes 
 - all main materials for the construcion of the network connection and their treatment
 - excavation of the cable trench
 - land transformation and use
  - It is assumed that all parts will hold for the lifetime of 20 years and don't have to be replaced.

This dataset doesn't include 
 - neither the energy use for assembly of the different wind turbine parts nor their transportation from manufacture to the construction site
 - auxiliary materials such as packaging materials or vacuum fleece.
 - any losses of materials (waste) during the processing of the different wind turbine parts
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2811:Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, vehicle and cycle eng

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Image: Cable trench and characteristics of the onshore cable used for the connection of the offshore wind park [Ilskov H. (2003) Offshore work on the 150 kV substation and the submarine cable. In proceedings from: Eltra Day, October 22nd, 2003, Billund, Denmark] ;(Chataignere & Le Boulch 2003) do not provide any specification of the network connection (type and length of cables, voltage), therefore it is not possible to take into account any details on the possible layout of the wind park. Data are directly used as first approximation.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Data from a network connection for an Enercon E-66 1.5MW turbine have been extrapolated with a ratio on power 4.5MW/1.5MW.
This dataset valid for 4.5MW onshore wind turbine network connections is based on one single type of a 4.5MW onshore wind turbine (Enercon 4.5MW wind turbine; where Enercon held a market share of ca.13% in the wind turbine market in 2001/02 (Chataign√®re et al. 2003)). 

Primary source of this dataset is a report from 2003 which mainly refers to data from 1998. Uncertainty was adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. The shares of "polyvinylchloride, emulsion polymersied" and "polyvinylchloride, suspension polymerised" in the cancelled ecoinvent v2 "aluminium production mix" dataset amounted to 12.8% (emulsion) and 87.2% (suspension) respectively. These shares have been overtaken to distribute the original amount of 2241 kg polyvinylchloride.These shares correspond to the European distribution of the different PVC types.

The value for a network connection for a 1.5MW turbine has been extrapolated (747 kg * 4.5/1.5).

exchanges.description: Literature value. Light weight concrete (12000 kg) extrapolated with a capacity factor 4.5MW/1.5MW from a 1.5MW wind turbine network connection. For conversion to m3, the normal density of 2400 kg/m3 given in the source is assumed; there is no light weight concrete exchange available in the database and normal concrete is used as proxy. There are no comments on the density of the light weight concrete in the given source. As the density range of light weight concrete varies in a large band and normal conrete is used as proxy, no new assumption was made.
